segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.

segments.pli: Atha kho soṇo gahapatiputto yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho soṇo gahapatiputto bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then the householder Soṇa went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:

segments.pli: “ko nu kho, bhante, hetu, ko paccayo yena m’idhekacce sattā diṭṭheva dhamme no parinibbāyanti?
segments.en: “What is the cause, sir, what is the reason why some sentient beings aren’t fully extinguished in the present life?

segments.pli: Ko pana, bhante, hetu, ko paccayo yena m’idhekacce sattā diṭṭheva dhamme parinibbāyantī”ti?
segments.en: What is the cause, sir, what is the reason why some sentient beings are fully extinguished in the present life?” …
(This should be told in full as in SN 35.118.)

segments.pli: Ayaṃ kho, soṇa, hetu, ayaṃ paccayo yena m’idhekacce sattā diṭṭheva dhamme parinibbāyantīti.

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha,…

suttaplex.blurb: At Rājagaha, the householder Soṇa asks the Buddha why some become awakened in this very life, while others do not.
